description: Shifts left under AND-convolution with itself.
comments: a(A000225(n)) mod 2 = 1, a(A062289(n)) mod 2 = 0. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 02 2012]
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210.
mathematica: a[0]=1; a[1]=1; a[n_] := a[n] = Sum[BitAnd[a[k], a[n-k-1]], {k, 0, n-1}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 60}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Sep 07 2012 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.Bits ((.&.))a007461 n = a007461_list !! na007461_list = 1 : f [1,1] where   f xs = x : f (x:xs) where     x = sum $ zipWith (.&.) xs $ tail $ reverse xs :: Integer-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 02 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
